Vrt pred počitkom
Večino pridelkov smo pospravili, nekatere pa lahko pustimo kar na prostem; listni ohrovt dobro prenaša mraz.
07 Nov 2019, 13:53 by Andreja Sušnik



Po prvi zmrzali se listi odebelijo, postanejo mehkejši in hrustljavi. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Gnoj potrebuje več mesecev, da se primerno razgradi in iz njega rastline lahko črpajo hranila. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Narava nas je obdarila s prekrasnim babjim poletjem, ki je trajalo od sredine in vse do zadnjih dni oktobra, ko so nas spremljale nadpovprečne temperature zraka. V večjem delu Slovenije se je letošnji oktober uvrstil med vrsto najtoplejših v obdobju 1961–2019. Temperaturni odklon je bil večinoma med 1,5 in 2,5 °C glede na obdobje 1981–2010, na Primorskem nekoliko manjši, večji pa v visokogorju.Letošnji oktober je bil skromen po padavinah, le v Julijskih Alpah je padlo nad 100 mm, drugod večinoma med 40 in 90 mm. Okrog 20 odstotkov več sončnih žarkov kot običajno nas je grelo. Toplo obdobje se je v zadnjih oktobrskih dneh končalo s hladno fronto. Meja sneženja se je spustila do nadmorske višine 1400 m. V prazničnih dneh je bilo večinoma suho, po nižinah v notranjosti večinoma oblačno, le na Primorskem je oblake razpihala burja. V prvih novembrskih dneh so se nad Slovenijo pomikale vremenske fronte, ki so prinesle obilne padavine. Ponekod v zahodni Sloveniji je čez vikend padlo več kot 250 mm dežja. Obilne so bile padavine tudi v južni Sloveniji, na vzhodu bolj skromne. Zaradi pričakovanih dolgotrajnejših nalivov je Agencija RS za okolje za zahodni in osrednji del države izdala oranžno opozorilo.
Če za Martina (11. 11.) sonce sije, huda zima bo.
Gnojimo jeseni


Gnoj potrebuje več mesecev, da se primerno razgradi in iz njega rastline lahko črpajo hranila. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

Čeprav se dnevi krajšajo in se počasi približuje zima ter smo večino pridelkov že pospravili, delo na vrtu še ni končano, tla lahko pripravimo na naslednjo vegetacijsko sezono. Počakajmo, da bo deževje mimo in se bodo nekoliko osušila; nato nadomestimo organsko snov v tleh, ki smo jo pobrali skupaj s pridelkom. Gredice lahko prekopljemo ali prerahljamo brez obračanja in po površini potresemo organsko gnojilo. Gnoj je nujno dodajati jeseni, saj potrebuje več mesecev, da se primerno razgradi in iz njega rastline lahko črpajo hranila. Če želimo, da bo gnojenje učinkovito, ga je treba dodati še pred začetkom mraza, ko je zemlja še primerno topla, da se lahko že jeseni začne njegova razgradnja. Pomembno je tudi, da ga ne zakopljemo pregloboko, saj je za razgradnjo potreben zrak, ki ga v nižjih plasteh tal ni dovolj. Ni priporočljivo, da ga samo posipljemo po površini, s tem izgubljamo hranila, hkrati pa tudi obremenjujemo okolje. Določene vrtnine ne marajo gnojenja z gnojem, med njimi so predvsem čebulnice in stročnice. Za dobro prehranjenost drugih vrtnin zadošča 2,5 litra hlevskega ali konjskega gnoja na kvadratni meter. Količino gnoja torej prilagodimo gredicam.
Čeprav se bliža zima, delo na vrtu še ni zaključeno, tla lahko pripravimo na naslednjo vegetacijsko sezono
Zapostavljeni listni ohrovt
Listni ohrovt je zimska zelenjava, ki prenese mraz, zato ga lahko pustimo kar na prostem, celo boljši okus dobi na mrazu. Botanično ime je Brassica oleracea L. var. acephala in spada v družino križnic. Skupina acephala se nanaša na katero koli vrsto Brassice, ki raste brez tako imenovane glave, značilne za številne sorte zelja. V to skupino spadajo številne divje in gojene vrste, od katerih mnoge gojijo zaradi užitnih listov in cvetov. V naravi, predvsem v Sredozemlju, uspeva kot dvoletnica, gojena pa je kot enoletnica. Sejemo ga junija in ga postopno do začetka avgusta presajamo na gredice, ki se praznijo. Rastlina na vrtu zraste do meter in pol visoko. Iz stebla razraščajo kodravi ali gladki temno zeleni listi. Sredica listnega ohrovta je bela in ni okusna, listi so močnega okusa. Po prvi zmrzali se listi odebelijo, postanejo mehkejši in hrustljavi. Najprej obiramo spodnje liste in šele nato osrednji del. Obiramo jih lahko vso zimo. Čim dlje ga skladiščimo na vrtu, v mili zimi tudi do januarja. Lahko ga posadimo tudi v pesek v vlažnih kleteh. Listnati ohrovt vsebuje veliko vitaminov in rudnin, vitamina C je na primer v listih dvakrat več kot v limonah, kalcija pa dvakrat več kot v mleku. Bogat je z glukozinolati, flavonoidi, s karotenoidi, fenolnimi kislinami in drugimi sestavinami, spodbuja presnovo, razstruplja. Temnejše zeleni listi vsebujejo več učinkovin. Praznik vinaMartinovanje je pri nas postalo eden pomembnejših ljudskih praznikov. Praznujemo ga 11. novembra, ko goduje sv. Martin, ki mošt spremeni v vin'. Je zavetnik vina in vinarjev in praznovanje se raztegne še na teden prej in potem. Praznovanje martinovega izhaja iz obdobja pred našim štetjem. V jesenskih praznovanjih so se naši poganski predniki zahvaljevali bogovom za dobro letino in jih hkrati prosili za ponovitev obilja v prihodnjem letu. Obstajajo predvidevanja, da naj bi krščanski Martin nasledil keltsko božanstvo, ki mu je bila naložena skrb za zahvalno praznovanje ob koncu letine. V Sloveniji se dan sv. Martina praznuje predvsem kot praznik vina. Najbolj znana legenda o svetem Martinu je tista, ki pripoveduje o njegovem srečanju z gosmi: bil je zelo spoštovan krščanski duhovnik, in ko so ga verniki iskali, da bi mu sporočili, da je izvoljen za škofa, se je skril v hlev med gosi, te pa so ga z gaganjem izdale. Od tedaj so kaznovane s smrtjo, kot pečenke končajo prav na martinovo.

Garden before rest
Most crops are harvested and some can be left outdoors; foliage tolerates cold well.
07 Nov 2019, 13:53 by Andreja Susnik



After the first frost, the leaves thicken, become softer and crispier. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



It takes months for the manure to decompose properly and the plants can extract nutrients from it. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


Nature has endowed us with a wonderful grandma summer that lasted from mid to late October, when we were accompanied by above average air temperatures. In most of Slovenia, October was one of the warmest in the period 1961–2019. The temperature deviation was mostly between 1.5 and 2.5 ° C from 1981–2010, slightly lower in the Primorska region and higher in the highlands. elsewhere mostly between 40 and 90 mm. About 20 percent more sunshine than we normally did. The warm period ended with a cold front in the last October days. The snowfall has dropped to an altitude of 1400 m. During the holidays, it was mostly dry, mostly in the lowlands in the interior mostly cloudy, only in Primorska, clouds were blowing in the bora. In the first days of November, weather fronts were moving over Slovenia, bringing heavy rainfall. In some places in western Slovenia more than 250 mm of rain fell over the weekend. There was also heavy rainfall in southern Slovenia, more moderate in the east. Due to the expected longer rain, the Environmental Agency of the Republic of Slovenia issued an orange warning for the western and central parts of the country.
If the sun is shining for Martin (11/11), it will be a severe winter.
We fertilize in the fall


It takes months for the manure to decompose properly and the plants can extract nutrients from it. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

Although the days are getting shorter and winter is slowly approaching and most of the crops have already been harvested, the work on the garden is not over yet, the soil can be prepared for the next growing season. Let’s wait for the rain to pass and it will dry a bit; then we replace the organic matter in the soil that we picked up along with the crop. Billets can be dug or loosened without turning and sprinkling organic fertilizer on the surface. It is essential to add manure in the fall, as it takes months to properly decompose and allow the plants to extract nutrients. If fertilization is to be effective, it should be added before the cold starts, when the soil is still warm enough to begin its decomposition in the fall. It is also important not to bury it too deep, as decomposition requires air, which is not enough in the lower layers of the soil. It is not recommended to just sprinkle it over the surface, thus losing nutrients while also burdening the environment. Certain vegetables do not like manure, including bulbs and legumes. For good nutrition of other vegetables, 2.5 liters of shed or horse manure per square meter is sufficient. Therefore, the amount of manure is adjusted to the billets.
Although winter is approaching, the work on the garden is not yet complete, the soil can be prepared for the next growing season
Neglected leafy sprouts
Leafy kale is a winter vegetable that can withstand the cold, so it can be left in the open, even better when it gets cold. The botanical name is Brassica oleracea L. var. acephala and belongs to the family of crosses. The acephala group refers to any type of Brassica that grows without the so-called head, characteristic of many varieties of cabbage. This group includes many wild and cultivated species, many of which are grown for their edible leaves and flowers. In nature, especially in the Mediterranean, it thrives as a biennial, but is grown as a yearling. We sow it in June and gradually transplant it to the empty beds by the beginning of August. The plant in the garden grows up to a meter and a half high. From the stem grow curly or smooth dark green leaves. The core of the leafy kale is white and not palatable, the leaves taste strong. After the first frost, the leaves thicken, become softer and crispier. First we pick the lower leaves and then the center. We can harvest them all winter long. It is stored in the garden for as long as possible, in the winter to January. It can also be planted in sand in damp cellars. Leafy kale contains many vitamins and minerals, for example, vitamin C is twice as high in leaves as it is in lemons, and calcium is twice as high in milk. It is rich in glucosinolates, flavonoids, carotenoids, phenolic acids and other ingredients, promotes metabolism, detoxifies. Darker green leaves contain more active ingredients. Wine FestivalMartinning has become one of the most important folk holidays in Slovenia. It is celebrated on November 11th, when St. Martin who turns must into wine '. He is the patron saint of wine and winemakers and the celebration extends to the week before and after. The celebration of martinis dates from the period before our counting. In the fall celebrations, our pagan ancestors thanked the gods for a good harvest and at the same time asked them to replicate the abundance of the coming year. It is speculated that Christian Martin is expected to succeed the Celtic deity, who has been entrusted with the care of Thanksgiving at the end of the harvest. In Slovenia, St. It celebrates Martina primarily as a wine holiday. The most famous legend of St. Martin is the one that tells of his encounter with the geese: he was a highly respected Christian priest, and when believers sought to inform him that he was elected bishop, he hid in a stable among geese. and they betrayed him by gagging. Since then, they have been punished with death, as roasts end up on the martinis.
